docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: The Democratic majority on the House Ways and Means Committee agreed today to try to reduce the surtax that many older Americans pay to insure against the cost of prolonged illness.

headline.main: Democrats Agree to Effort To Reduce Medicare Surtax

docs.snippet: LEAD: The Democratic majority on the House Ways and Means Committee agreed today to try to reduce the surtax that many older Americans pay to insure against the cost of prolonged illness.

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: HOUSE COMMITTEE ON WAYS AND MEANS

byline.original: By MARTIN TOLCHIN, Special to The New York Times

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: The chairman of the Senate Finance Committee said today that hopes were fading for reducing the surtax that older Americans pay to insure against the cost of prolonged illness.

headline.main: Bentsen Sees Dim Hope of Cutting Health Surtax Paid by the Elderly

docs.snippet: LEAD: The chairman of the Senate Finance Committee said today that hopes were fading for reducing the surtax that older Americans pay to insure against the cost of prolonged illness.

byline.original: By MARTIN TOLCHIN, Special to The New York Times

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: IN the century since electric power revolutionized human existence, most people have scarcely thought, if at all, about whether it is safe to live with the electromagnetic fields radiated by the cables, wires, fixtures and appliances all around them. When the question did come up, scientists generally assured the public that there was no danger to health.

headline.main: Scientists Debate Health Hazards of Electromagnetic Fields
